intro: Sprengelia involucrata, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a rough texture. Sprengelia involucrata thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas or along stream banks.
